etymology.description: semantic 宀(宀) (mián, "roof") + phonetic 元(元) (yuán, "origin") = under a roof, things come to completion -> finished, intact
etymology.interpretation: The character 完(完) (wán, "finished") combines 宀(宀) (mián, "roof") to convey the idea of enclosure or home, with 元(元) (yuán, "origin") providing the pronunciation and implying the completion of a process or development under a roof.

examples.chinese: 我做完作业(我做完作業)，就去睡觉(就去睡覺)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuò wán zuòyè, jiù qù shuìjiào.
examples.english: After I finished my homework, I went to sleep.

examples.chinese: 风暴过后(風暴過後)，建筑依然完好(建築依然完好)。
examples.english: After the storm, the building remained intact.
